title: The First Declaration
description: Declare an integer variable `x` and set it to 42. Print it to the console.

title: Type Juggler
description: Read an integer from input, multiply it by 2, and print the result.
hints: Use `cout << n * 2;` to print the doubled value

title: The Swapper
description: Read two integers `a` and `b`, then print them swapped (b first, then a), separated by a space.
hints: You can use a temp variable, or just print in reverse order

title: The Counter
description: Read an integer `n` and print numbers from 1 to n, each on a new line.
hints: Use a `for` loop: `for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++)`
Print each number with `cout << i << endl;`

title: Sum Seeker
description: Read an integer `n` and print the sum of all integers from 1 to n.
hints: Use a loop to accumulate: `sum += i;`

title: FizzBuzz Knight
description: Read `n`. For each number 1 to n: print "Fizz" if divisible by 3, "Buzz" if by 5, "FizzBuzz" if by both, else the number. One per line.

test_cases.expected_output:
1
2
Fizz
4
Buzz
Fizz
7
8
Fizz
Buzz
11
Fizz
13
14
FizzBuzz
test_cases.name: fifteen

hints: Check divisibility by 15 first (FizzBuzz), then 3, then 5

title: The Reverser
description: Read an integer `n`, then `n` integers. Print them in reverse order, separated by spaces.
hints: Store the numbers in an array first, then loop backwards

title: The Factorial
description: Write a function `factorial(int n)` that returns n!. Read n from input and print factorial(n).
hints: Or use a loop: result *= i for i in 1..n
